citeinfo.origin: National Climatic Data Center (NCDC), National Environmental Satellite, Data and Information Service (NESDIS), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)
citeinfo.title: Ocean Currents and Hourly, Daily, and Monthly Marine Weather and Cyclones for the North Pacific Ocean and China Sea (1854-1938)

abstract.p: Publication Title: Zeegebieden rond Australie : oceanografische en meteorologische gegevens (pub.1949). Text in Dutch and English.
"A continuation of publication K.N.M.I. no. 115, Oceanographic and meteorological observations in the China Seas and in the western part of the North Pacific Ocean (1935, 1936).

Contains monthly mean total cloud, fog, mist, precipitation, correction and mean sea level pressure, sea and air surface temperatures, Beaufort 8 and up gales, ocean currents, resultant wind direction and force, tropical cyclone tracks, and depressions for the period from 1854-1938; duration of fog, mist, and precipitation; annual, daily, and bi-hourly range and standard deviation of correction pressure; frequency distribution of fog, mist, precipitation (including hours), gales, and depressions; intensity of tropical cyclones; and minimum ocean currents.
Available from the NOAA Library System: URL http://www.lib.noaa.gov/.

descript.purpose: This publication is in the National Climatic Data Center's Foreign Data Library, and is one of many books, atlases, maps, charts and other printed materials received by the NCDC from many nations over the years.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
